member.name: T:LitS3.CannedAcl
member.summary: Access Control Lists that are predefined by Amazon and supported when adding objects.

member.name: F:LitS3.CannedAcl.Private
member.summary: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL. No one else has access rights (default).

member.name: F:LitS3.CannedAcl.PublicRead
member.summary: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL and the anonymous principal is granted READ access. If this policy is used on an object, it can be read from a browser with no authentication.

member.name: F:LitS3.CannedAcl.PublicReadWrite
member.summary: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL, the anonymous principal is granted READ and WRITE access. This is a useful policy to apply to a bucket, if you intend for any anonymous user to PUT objects into the bucket.

member.name: F:LitS3.CannedAcl.AuthenticatedRead
member.summary: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL, and any principal authenticated as a registered Amazon S3 user is granted READ access.

member.name: T:LitS3.AddObjectRequest
member.summary: Uploads an object to S3.

member.name: T:LitS3.S3Request`1
member.summary: Common base class for all concrete S3Requests, pairs each one tightly with its S3Response counterpart.

member.name: T:LitS3.S3Request
member.summary: The base class for all S3 requests.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Request.Service
member.summary: Gets the service this request will operate against.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Request.HaveResponse
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a response has been received from S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Request.KeepAlive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to make a persistent connection to S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Request.Proxy
member.summary: Gets or sets proxy information for this request.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Request.ReadWriteTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out in milliseconds when writing to or reading from a stream. The default value is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Request.ServicePoint
member.summary: Gets the service point to use for this request. See remarks on this property if you plan on using Expect100Continue.
member.remarks: In specific circumstances, the S3 request will hang indefinitely if Expect100Continue is set to true and S3 immediately responds with a HTTP 5xx server error after the request is issued and before any data is written to the stream. The downside to leaving this property at false is that you'll waste bandwidth and time if S3 knows the PUT is going to fail at the very start of the request.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Request`1.GetResponse
member.summary: Gets the S3 REST response synchronously.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Request`1.BeginGetResponse(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request to S3.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Request`1.EndGetResponse(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronous call to BeginGetResponse().

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Request`1.Abort
member.summary: Cancels an asynchronous request to S3.

member.name: M:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.GetRequestStream
member.summary: Submits the request to the server and retrieves a Stream for writing object data to.

member.name: M:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.PerformWithRequestStream(System.Action{System.IO.Stream})
member.summary: Submits the request to the server and performs the given action with the request stream which should be filled with the object's data. The GetResponse() method will automatically be called after the action is executed.

member.name: M:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.BeginGetRequestStream(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request for a Stream object to use to write object data.

member.name: M:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.EndGetRequestStream(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronous call to BeginGetRequestStream().

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.CannedAcl
member.summary: Gets or sets the "canned" access control to apply to this object. The default is Private. More complex permission sets than the CannedAcl values are allowed, but you must use SetObjectAclRequest (not currently implemented).

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.Expires
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional expiration date of the object. If specified, it will be stored by S3 and returned as a standard Expires header when the object is retrieved.

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.Metadata
member.summary: Gets a collection where you can store name/value metadata pairs to be stored along with this object. Since we are using the REST API, the names and values are limited to ASCII encoding. Additionally, Amazon imposes a 2k limit on the total HTTP header size which includes metadata. Note that LitS3 manages adding the special "x-amz-meta" prefix for you.

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.CacheControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache control for this request as the raw HTTP header you would like S3 to return along with your object when requested. An example value for this might be "max-age=3600, must-revalidate".

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the MIME type of this object. It will be stored by S3 and returned as a standard Content-Type header when the object is retrieved.

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.ContentLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the object you are adding. Setting this property is required.

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.ContentMD5
member.summary: Gets or sets the base64 encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the message (without the headers) according to RFC 1864.

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets presentational information for the object. It will be stored by S3 and returned as a standard Content-Disposition header when the object is retrieved.
member.remarks: One use of this header is to cause a browser to download this resource as a file attachment instead of displaying it inline. For that behavior, use a string like: "Content-disposition: attachment; filename=mytextfile.txt"

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectRequest.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the specified encoding of the object data. It will be stored by S3 and returned as a standard Content-Encoding header when the object is retrieved.

member.name: T:LitS3.AddObjectResponse
member.summary: Represents the response returned by S3 after adding an object with AddObjectRequest.

member.name: T:LitS3.S3Response
member.summary: Provides a base class which encapsulates an Amazon REST WebResponse and sets up an appropriate XmlReader for the kinds of XML data Amazon sends back.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Response.Close
member.summary: Closes our response stream. You must call this method when you are finished with this response.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Response.Reader
member.summary: Gets an XmlReader for parsing Amazon XML responses, creating one if necessary and calling MoveToContent().

member.name: P:LitS3.AddObjectResponse.ETag
member.summary: Gets the added object's ETag as calculated by S3. You can compare this to an ETag you calculate locally to verify that S3 received the file correctly.

member.name: T:LitS3.Bucket
member.summary: Represents a bucket hosted by Amazon S3 that contains objects.

member.name: P:LitS3.Bucket.Name
member.summary: The name of this bucket.

member.name: P:LitS3.Bucket.CreationDate
member.summary: The creation time of this bucket, as determined by S3.

member.name: T:LitS3.BucketAccess
member.summary: Indicates the accessibility of a bucket.

member.name: F:LitS3.BucketAccess.Accessible
member.summary: The bucket is owned and accessible by you.

member.name: F:LitS3.BucketAccess.NotAccessible
member.summary: The bucket is owned by someone else.

member.name: F:LitS3.BucketAccess.NoSuchBucket
member.summary: The bucket does not exist.

member.name: T:LitS3.MetadataDirective
member.summary: For COPY operations, indicates whether the metadata is copied from the source object or replaced with metadata provided in the request. If copied, it remains unchanged. Otherwise, all original metadata is replaced by the metadata you specify.

member.name: F:LitS3.MetadataDirective.Automatic
member.summary: Check the contents of the Metadata property. If empty, Copy, else Replace.

member.name: F:LitS3.MetadataDirective.Copy
member.summary: Copy the metadata from the source object. This is the default.

member.name: F:LitS3.MetadataDirective.Replace
member.summary: Replace the metadata with the metadata specified in the COPY operation.

member.name: T:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest
member.summary: Copies an existing object in S3. Even if you successfully get a CopyObjectResponse without an exception, you should inspect it to see if any errors occurred while copying.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest.CannedAcl
member.summary: Gets or sets the "canned" access control to apply to this object. The default is Private. More complex permission sets than the CannedAcl values are allowed, but you must use SetObjectAclRequest (not currently implemented).

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest.CopyIfMatchETag
member.summary: Gets or sets the ETag value that will be used to conditionally execute the COPY operation on S3. If the ETag value set here does not match the ETag of the source object, S3 will return a "412 Precondition Failed" error.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest.CopyIfNoneMatchETag
member.summary: Gets or sets the ETag value that will be used to conditionally execute the COPY operation on S3. If the ETag value set here matches the ETag of the source object, S3 will return a "412 Precondition Failed" error.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest.CopyIfUnmodifiedSince
member.summary: Gets or sets the date value that will be used to conditionally execute the COPY operation on S3. If the date value set here matches the "Last-Modified" data of the source object, S3 will return a "412 Precondition Failed" error.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest.CopyIfModifiedSince
member.summary: Gets or sets the date value that will be used to conditionally execute the COPY operation on S3. If the date value set here does not match the "Last-Modified" data of the source object, S3 will return a "412 Precondition Failed" error.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest.Metadata
member.summary: Gets a collection where you can store name/value metadata pairs to be stored along with this object. Since we are using the REST API, the names and values are limited to ASCII encoding. Additionally, Amazon imposes a 2k limit on the total HTTP header size which includes metadata. Note that LitS3 manages adding the special "x-amz-meta" prefix for you.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectRequest.MetadataDirective
member.summary: Gets or sets the metadata directive for the current COPY operation. The metadata directive tells S3 whether to copy the metadata from the source object (default) or replace the metadata of the new object with the provided metadata.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectResponse.LastModified
member.summary: Gets the last time this object was modified, as calculated internally and stored by S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectResponse.ETag
member.summary: Gets the ETag of this object as calculated internally and stored by S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.CopyObjectResponse.Error
member.summary: Gets the error that occurred during the copy operation, if any.

member.name: T:LitS3.CreateBucketRequest
member.summary: Creates a new bucket hosted by S3.

member.name: M:LitS3.CreateBucketRequest.#ctor(LitS3.S3Service,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.param: True if you want to request that Amazon create this bucket in the Europe location. Otherwise, false to let Amazon decide.

member.name: T:LitS3.CreateBucketResponse
member.summary: Represents an S3 response for a created bucket.

member.name: P:LitS3.CreateBucketResponse.Location
member.summary: The location of the created bucket, as returned by Amazon in the Location header.

member.name: T:LitS3.DeleteBucketRequest
member.summary: Deletes a bucket from S3. The bucket must be empty.

member.name: T:LitS3.DeleteBucketResponse
member.summary: Represents an S3 response for a deleted bucket.

member.name: T:LitS3.DeleteObjectRequest
member.summary: Deletes an object in an S3 bucket.

member.name: T:LitS3.DeleteObjectResponse
member.summary: Represents the response for deleting an S3 object.

member.name: T:LitS3.GetAllBucketsRequest
member.summary: Gets all buckets owned by you.

member.name: T:LitS3.GetAllBucketsResponse
member.summary: Contains the S3 response with all your owned buckets.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetAllBucketsResponse.Buckets
member.summary: Provides a forward-only reader for efficiently enumerating through the response list of Buckets.

member.name: T:LitS3.GetBucketLocationRequest
member.summary: Queries S3 for the hosted location of a bucket.

member.name: T:LitS3.GetBucketLocationResponse
member.summary: The S3 response for the hosted location of a bucket.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetBucketLocationResponse.IsEurope
member.summary: Gets true if the bucket was created in the Europe location.

member.name: T:LitS3.GetObjectRequest
member.summary: Gets an S3 object, partial object, or just object metadata.

member.name: M:LitS3.GetObjectRequest.AddRange(System.Int32)
member.summary: Requests a partial object. You can only add one range request.
member.param: Example: Assume an object with a size of 1000 bytes. AddRange(300) will return all bytes from byte 300 (bytes 300-999), that is: 700 bytes in total. AddRange(-300) will return the last 300 bytes (bytes 700-999), that is: 300 bytes in total.

member.name: M:LitS3.GetObjectRequest.AddRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Requests a partial object. You can only add one range request.
member.param: Example: Assume an object with a size of 1000 bytes. AddRange(0,499) will return the first 500 bytes (byte offsets 0-499, inclusive). AddRange(500,999) will return The second 500 bytes (byte offsets 500-999, inclusive).

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectRequest.IfModifiedSince
member.summary: Gets or sets: Return the object only if it has been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectRequest.IfUnmodifiedSince
member.summary: Gets or sets: Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectRequest.IfMatch
member.summary: Gets or sets: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).

member.name: T:LitS3.GetObjectResponse
member.summary: Represents the S3 response containing the queried object's metadata and/or data.

member.name: M:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.GetResponseStream
member.summary: Gets a stream containing the object data (if included).

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.MissingMetadataHeaders
member.summary: Gets the number of metadata entries that were not returned due to the limitations of the REST API.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.Metadata
member.summary: Gets a collection of name/value metadata pairs associated with this object. Note that LitS3 manages removing the special "x-amz-meta" header prefix for you.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.LastModified
member.summary: Gets the last time this object was modified, as calculated internally and stored by S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.ETag
member.summary: Gets the ETag of this object as calculated internally and stored by S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the MIME type of the object. This is set to the same value specified when adding the object. The default content type is binary/octet-stream.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets the optioanl disposition header, if one was specified when adding the object. The exception is BitTorrent files which have a non-empty default disposition.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: Gets the size of the response data stream.

member.name: P:LitS3.GetObjectResponse.ContentRange
member.summary: Gets the HTTP header describing the range of bytes returned in the event that a partial object was requested using AddObject.AddRange().

member.name: T:LitS3.Identity
member.summary: Represents an Amazon S3 user.

member.name: T:LitS3.ListEntry
member.summary: The base class for items returned by a ListObjectsRequest. The only two concrete subclasses are ObjectEntry and CommonPrefix.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListEntry.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this entry, which is the portion of the key or common prefix after the search prefix.

member.name: T:LitS3.ObjectEntry
member.summary: Represents an S3 Object.

member.name: P:LitS3.ObjectEntry.Key
member.summary: Gets the unique S3 Object key.

member.name: P:LitS3.ObjectEntry.LastModified
member.summary: Gets the last modified date of this object, as determined by S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.ObjectEntry.ETag
member.summary: Gets the ETag of this object, as computed by S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.ObjectEntry.Size
member.summary: Get the size of this object.

member.name: P:LitS3.ObjectEntry.Owner
member.summary: Gets the owner of this object.

member.name: T:LitS3.CommonPrefix
member.summary: Represents a common prefix rolled up by a ListObjectsRequest. In a filesystem-like interpretation of Amazon S3 using a delimiter of "/", you might consider this a "directory".

member.name: P:LitS3.CommonPrefix.Prefix
member.summary: Gets the prefix common to one or more items found by the ListObjectsRequest.

member.name: T:LitS3.ListObjectsArgs
member.summary: A structure passed to ListObjectRequest which describes the range of items to search for.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsArgs.Prefix
member.summary: Limits the response to keys which begin with the indicated prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into different sets of keys in a way similar to how a file system uses folders.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsArgs.Marker
member.summary: Indicates where in the bucket to begin listing. The list will only include keys that occur lexicographically after marker. This is convenient for pagination: To get the next page of results use the last key of the current page as the marker.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsArgs.Delimiter
member.summary: Causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element in the CommonPrefixes collection. These rolled-up keys are not returned elsewhere in the response.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsArgs.MaxKeys
member.summary: The maximum number of keys you'd like to see in the response body. The server might return fewer than this many keys, but will not return more.

member.name: T:LitS3.ListObjectsRequest
member.summary: An S3 request which searches for items in a bucket.

member.name: T:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse
member.summary: An S3 response describing the requested contents of a bucket.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.BucketName
member.summary: Gets the bucket queried in the original request.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.Prefix
member.summary: Gets the prefix specified in the original request.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.Marker
member.summary: Gets the marker specified in the original request.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.MaxKeys
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of keys specified in the original request.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.Delimiter
member.summary: Gets the delimiter specified in the original request.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.IsTruncated
member.summary: Gets whether the list of itmes was truncated by the server because too many matched or the number of items found was greater than the maximum keys specified in the request.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.NextMarker
member.summary: Gets a marker you can use in a second ListObjectRequest to get the next range of items. This will be non-null only if IsTruncated is true and Delimiter is not null.

member.name: P:LitS3.ListObjectsResponse.Entries
member.summary: Provides a forward-only reader for efficiently enumerating through the response list of objects and common prefixes.

member.name: T:LitS3.S3ProgressEventArgs
member.summary: Provides progress data for S3 object transfer operations.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3ProgressEventArgs.BucketName
member.summary: Gets the bucket of the object being transferred.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3ProgressEventArgs.Key
member.summary: Gets the key of the object being transferred.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3ProgressEventArgs.BytesTransferred
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes transferred.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3ProgressEventArgs.BytesTotal
member.summary: Gets the total number of bytes in the transfer operation.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Authorizer.AuthorizeRequest(System.Net.HttpWebRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Signs the given HttpWebRequest using the HTTP Authorization header with a value generated using the contents of the request plus our SecretAccessKey.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Authorizer.Compare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Implements string comparison for the purpose of sorting amazon request headers lexographically. The default string.Compare() is "interesting", in that it attempts to sort words according to current locale settings. What we want is the old-school sorting based on the numeric value of each char, which is what CompareOrdinal does.

member.name: T:LitS3.DateTimeEpochExtension
member.summary: Assists in converting DateTime objects into the seconds-since-epoch required by some parts of S3.

member.name: T:LitS3.S3ErrorCode
member.summary: Represents the possible error codes that can be returned by S3.
member.remarks: The list of codes was parsed from here: http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/ErrorCodeList.html

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.Unknown
member.summary: Represents a code unknown to this class.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.AccessDenied
member.summary: Access Denied

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.AccountProblem
member.summary: There is a problem with your AWS account that prevents the operation from completing successfully. Please contact customer service at webservices@amazon.com.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.AmbiguousGrantByEmailAddress
member.summary: The e-mail address you provided is associated with more than one account.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.BadDigest
member.summary: The Content-MD5 you specified did not match what we received.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.BucketAlreadyExists
member.summary: The requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is shared by all users of the system. Please select a different name and try again.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou
member.summary: Your previous request to create the named bucket succeeded and you already own it.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.BucketNotEmpty
member.summary: The bucket you tried to delete is not empty.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.CredentialsNotSupported
member.summary: This request does not support credentials.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.CrossLocationLoggingProhibited
member.summary: Cross location logging not allowed. Buckets in one geographic location cannot log information to a bucket in another location.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.EntityTooSmall
member.summary: Your proposed upload is smaller than the minimum allowed object size.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.EntityTooLarge
member.summary: Your proposed upload exceeds the maximum allowed object size.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.ExpiredToken
member.summary: The provided token has expired.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.IncompleteBody
member.summary: You did not provide the number of bytes specified by the Content-Length HTTP header

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.IncorrectNumberOfFilesInPostRequest
member.summary: POST requires exactly one file upload per request.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InlineDataTooLarge
member.summary: Inline data exceeds the maximum allowed size.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InternalError
member.summary: We encountered an internal error. Please try again.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidAccessKeyId
member.summary: The AWS Access Key Id you provided does not exist in our records.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidAddressingHeader
member.summary: You must specify the Anonymous role.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidArgument
member.summary: Invalid Argument

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidBucketName
member.summary: The specified bucket is not valid.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidDigest
member.summary: The Content-MD5 you specified was an invalid.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidLocationConstraint
member.summary: The specified location constraint is not valid.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidPayer
member.summary: All access to this object has been disabled.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidPolicyDocument
member.summary: The content of the form does not meet the conditions specified in the policy document.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidRange
member.summary: The requested range cannot be satisfied.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidSecurity
member.summary: The provided security credentials are not valid.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidSOAPRequest
member.summary: The SOAP request body is invalid.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidStorageClass
member.summary: The storage class you specified is not valid.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidTargetBucketForLogging
member.summary: The target bucket for logging does not exist, is not owned by you, or does not have the appropriate grants for the log-delivery group.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidToken
member.summary: The provided token is malformed or otherwise invalid.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.InvalidURI
member.summary: Couldn't parse the specified URI.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.KeyTooLong
member.summary: Your key is too long.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MalformedACLError
member.summary: The XML you provided was not well-formed or did not validate against our published schema.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MalformedXML
member.summary: The XML you provided was not well-formed or did not validate against our published schema.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MaxMessageLengthExceeded
member.summary: Your request was too big.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MaxPostPreDataLengthExceededError
member.summary: Your POST request fields preceding the upload file were too large.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MetadataTooLarge
member.summary: Your metadata headers exceed the maximum allowed metadata size.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: The specified method is not allowed against this resource.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MissingAttachment
member.summary: A SOAP attachment was expected, but none were found.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MissingContentLength
member.summary: You must provide the Content-Length HTTP header.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MissingSecurityElement
member.summary: The SOAP 1.1 request is missing a security element.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.MissingSecurityHeader
member.summary: Your request was missing a required header.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.NoLoggingStatusForKey
member.summary: There is no such thing as a logging status sub-resource for a key.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.NoSuchBucket
member.summary: The specified bucket does not exist.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.NoSuchKey
member.summary: The specified key does not exist.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: A header you provided implies functionality that is not implemented.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.NotSignedUp
member.summary: Your account is not signed up for the Amazon S3 service. You must sign up before you can use Amazon S3. You can sign up at the following URL: http://aws.amazon.com/s3

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.OperationAborted
member.summary: A conflicting conditional operation is currently in progress against this resource. Please try again.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.PermanentRedirect
member.summary: The bucket you are attempting to access must be addressed using the specified endpoint. Please send all future requests to this endpoint.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: At least one of the pre-conditions you specified did not hold.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.Redirect
member.summary: Temporary redirect.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.RequestIsNotMultiPartContent
member.summary: Bucket POST must be of the enclosure-type multipart/form-data.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Your socket connection to the server was not read from or written to within the timeout period.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.RequestTimeTooSkewed
member.summary: The difference between the request time and the server's time is too large.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.RequestTorrentOfBucketError
member.summary: Requesting the torrent file of a bucket is not permitted.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.SignatureDoesNotMatch
member.summary: The request signature we calculated does not match the signature you provided. Check your AWS Secret Access Key and signing method. For more information, see Authenticating REST Requests and Authenticating SOAP Requests for details.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.SlowDown
member.summary: Please reduce your request rate.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary: You are being redirected to the bucket while DNS updates.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.TokenRefreshRequired
member.summary: The provided token must be refreshed.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.TooManyBuckets
member.summary: You have attempted to create more buckets than allowed.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.UnexpectedContent
member.summary: This request does not support content.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.UnresolvableGrantByEmailAddress
member.summary: The e-mail address you provided does not match any account on record.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3ErrorCode.UserKeyMustBeSpecified
member.summary: The bucket POST must contain the specified field name. If it is specified, please check the order of the fields.

member.name: F:LitS3.S3Headers.MissingMetadata
member.summary: This is set to the number of metadata entries not returned in x-amz-meta headers. This can happen if you create metadata using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose values are not legal HTTP headers.

member.name: T:LitS3.S3Exception
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the S3 server returns a specially formatted error object that we can parse.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Exception.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the error code returned by S3.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Exception.BucketName
member.summary: Gets the bucket name this error pertains to, if applicable.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Exception.RequestID
member.summary: Gets the ID of the request associated with the error.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Exception.HostID
member.summary: Gets the ID of the host that returned the error.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.ForEachBucket(System.Action{LitS3.Bucket})

member.param: The name of the bucket, which will be checked against the BucketNameChecking.Strict requirements.

member.summary: Queries S3 about the existance and ownership of the given bucket name.

member.summary: Returns true if the given object exists in the given bucket.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.IsBucketInEurope(System.String)
member.summary: Queries S3 to determine whether the given bucket resides in the Europe location.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.ListObjects(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Queries a bucket for a listing of objects it contains. Only objects with keys beginning with the given prefix will be returned. The DefaultDelimiter will be used. If you expect a large number of objects to be returned, consider using ListAllObjects().

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.ListAllObjects(System.String)
member.summary: Queries a bucket for a listing of all objects it contains. The DefaultDelimiter will be used.

member.summary: Queries a bucket for a listing of objects it contains. Only objects with keys beginning with the given prefix will be returned. The DefaultDelimiter will be used.

member.summary: Queries a bucket for a listing of objects it contains. Only objects with keys beginning with the given prefix will be returned.

member.summary: Queries a bucket for a listing of objects it contains and performs the given action on each object. The DefaultDelimiter will be used.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.ForEachObject(System.String,System.String,System.Action{LitS3.ListEntry})
member.summary: Queries a bucket for a listing of objects it contains and performs the given action on each object. Only objects with keys beginning with the given prefix will be returned. The DefaultDelimiter will be used.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.DeleteBucket(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the bucket with the given name.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.DeleteObject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the object in the specified bucket with the specified key.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.GetUrl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This constructs a Uri suitable for accessing the given object in the given bucket. It is not authorized, so it will only work for objects with anonymous read access. This method itself does not communicate with S3 and will return immediately.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.GetAuthorizedUrl(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates a pre-authorized URI valid for performing a GET on the given S3 object in the given bucket. This is useful for constructing a URL to hand over to a 3rd party (such as a web browser). The Uri will automatically expire after the time given. This method itself does not communicate with S3 and will return immediately.
member.remarks: You might expect this method to return a System.Uri instead of a string. It turns out there is a tricky issue with constructing Uri objects from these pre-authenticated url strings: The Uri.ToString() method will convert a properly-encoded "+" character back into a raw "+", which is interpreted by Amazon S3 as a space (standard URI conventions). So the signature will be misread if you were to take the Uri.ToString() and feed it to a browser. So instead, we'll give you a properly escaped URL string which will always work in a browser. If you want to, say, use it in a WebRequest instead, it turns out that WebRequest will leave it escaped properly and everything will work.

member.name: M:LitS3.S3Service.AddObject(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.String,LitS3.CannedAcl,System.Action{System.IO.Stream})
member.summary: Adds an object to S3 by acquiring the upload stream then allowing the given function to handle writing data into it.

member.name: E:LitS3.S3Service.AddObjectProgress
member.summary: Reports progress for any operation that adds an object to a bucket.

member.name: E:LitS3.S3Service.GetObjectProgress
member.summary: Reports progress for any operation that gets an object from a bucket.

member.name: E:LitS3.S3Service.BeforeAuthorize
member.summary: Fired before an S3Request operating against this service is authorized and sent out to the S3 server. This is a good opportunity to modify every S3Request created internally by this class, for instance, to set the Proxy server or ServicePoint.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Service.Host
member.summary: Gets or sets the hostname of the s3 server, usually "s3.amazonaws.com" unless you are using a 3rd party S3 implementation.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Service.UseSsl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to connect to the server using SSL. The default is true.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Service.UseSubdomains
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to prepend the bucket name as a subdomain when accessing a bucket. This is Amazon's preferred method, however the property defaults to false for greater compatibility with existing buckets.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Service.CustomPort
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom port to use to connect to the S3 server. The default is zero, which will let this class auto-select the port based on the UseSsl property.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Service.AccessKeyID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Amazon Access Key ID to use for authentication purposes.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Service.SecretAccessKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the Amazon Secret Access Key to use for authentication purposes.

member.name: P:LitS3.S3Service.DefaultDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the default delimiter to use when calling ListObjects(). The default is a forward-slash "/".
